title: Rangers' offseason may be for the best
subtitle: Patience might be unnerving but possibilites and potential are in abundance
body: The Rangers, it seemed, held the keys to the offseason. They had the money to be aggressive in free agency and the prospects to be creative in the trade market. And coming off a puzzling collapse last season, they had all the emotional incentive to be bold. So, what's happened? To this point, not nearly as much as some might have expected. Anthony Castrovince is a reporter for MLB.com. Read his columns and follow him on Twitter at @Castrovince. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Anthony Castrovince
